CLAUDE.md

Source: CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

Repository Overview

This is an R data package called ethord (ETH Board Open Research Data Program) that provides metadata and report data from 96 research projects. The package follows standard R package conventions and includes both R data files (.rda) and CSV exports for non-R users.

Key Commands

Build and Development

# Install the package and dependencies
Rscript -e "devtools::install()"

# Build package documentation
Rscript -e "devtools::document()"

# Build the package
Rscript -e "devtools::build()"

# Check the package (includes tests if any)
Rscript -e "devtools::check()"

# Build package website
Rscript -e "pkgdown::build_site()"

Data Processing Pipeline

The main data processing is done through pipeline.qmd:

# Run the data processing pipeline
quarto render pipeline.qmd

This pipeline: 1. Processes raw CSV files from data-raw/ 2. Applies data cleaning (standardizes column names, handles NA values, converts numeric to integer) 3. Generates R data files in data/ 4. Creates CSV exports in inst/extdata/ 5. Auto-generates data dictionaries using AI (gendict tool) 6. Sets up roxygen documentation for datasets

Package Installation

# Install from GitHub
devtools::install_github("Global-Health-Engineering/ethord", dependencies = TRUE)

Architecture and Structure

Data Flow

  1. Raw Data (data-raw/): Original CSV files and processing scripts
  2. Processing (pipeline.qmd): Automated pipeline using washr package functions
  3. Package Data (data/): Processed .rda files for R users
  4. External Data (inst/extdata/): CSV exports for non-R users
  5. Documentation (R/, man/): Auto-generated roxygen documentation

Key Components

  • Four main datasets: docs_detail, docs_proposal, docs_report, portal
  • AI-powered dictionary generation: Uses gendict tool to create data dictionaries
  • Package website: Built with pkgdown and stored in docs/
  • Processing functions: Custom process_csv() function handles data cleaning and export

Important Files

  • pipeline.qmd: Main data processing pipeline
  • DESCRIPTION: Package metadata and dependencies
  • _pkgdown.yml: Website configuration
  • data-raw/dictionary.csv: Data dictionary for all variables

Dependencies

The package relies on: - washr: Custom package for data processing workflows - gendict: Python tool for AI-generated data dictionaries - Standard R package development tools: devtools, roxygen2, pkgdown - Data manipulation: readr, janitor, dplyr

Notes

  • No test directory (common for data packages)
  • License: CC BY 4.0
  • Part of Global Health Engineering organization at ETH Zurich
  • Focuses on open research data practices and transparency
